page.title: 12BROOM, BEDS.
page.content: Only the northern section of this attractive village lies within the grid area, and its church, the Hall and major farms are to the south. The name 'Broom' originated because of the predominance of the{plant}in the area in former times, although it is no longer much in evidence to-day. The Post Office is now closed but the{Cock public house has existed on its present site for several centuries. { This part of Broom is all residential, with mostly modern housing, but including several sympathetically restored old cottages. The surrounding countryside is typical of this whole area, being flat and open and devoted to farming or market gardening. There are several individual stands of trees and a short stretch of water lying on a small tributary of the river Ivel.
